study_plan_entry.title: Principles of powder and densification processing

free_text.Learning outcomes: This course presents the fundamentals underlying materials processes whereby dense solids or components are produced from powder, with focus on ceramic and metallic materials and their composites.
free_text.Content: Main elements of the course are listed (and will be presented) as follows :[br/][br/]1.[][]Powder synthesis: main processes and a few of their fundamentals [br/][br/]2.[][]Powder characterization principles: descriptive parameters and characteristics of engineering powders[br/][br/]3.[][]Principal densification processes: nature and basic features[br/][br/]4.[][]Solid state densification mechanisms: underlying atomistic and microstructural phenomena[br/][br/]5.[][]Grain growth and microstructural development[br/][br/]6.[][]Macroscopic solid state densification theory[br/][br/]7.[][]Liquid phase sintering
free_text.Keywords: Powder synthesis, powder characterization, principal densification, microstructural development, liquid phase sintering
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Prerequisites for the course include a knowledge of thermodynamics, kinetics and transport phenomena (including diffusion), and of the physics of deformation, as relevant to materials science and engineering.
